reviewText:
Early Access Review

Introduction            	Storm United is a class based FPS game that very obviously takes inspiration from one of the best FPS game out there, Halo. (NOT a bad thing) Storm United does tons of things amazingly, but the lack of players on servers really hurts the games playability. (MP only) Right now, Storm United includes: twenty-one weapons, six maps, two classes, six game modes, and plenty of other features. Although Storm United shows tons of potential, the fact that it’s MP only and there is no way to play with bots really hurts this game. The gameplay is very solid, fast paced, and smooth. I have not been able to find anything (gameplay or functionality) wrong with the game.
Pros
Fast paced
Plenty of weapons
Cool classes
Varied game modes
Clan system
Well-made FPS
Linux support


Cons
Low sever population
Required to join clan
Some weapons don’t feel very satisfying to shoot
Servers a quite laggy at times


Conclusion
Storm United is a class based FPS game that’s surprisingly polished for being in Early Access. While the gameplay is tons of fun and having tons of different maps/weapons/gamemodes, Storm United suffers from the lack of player on the servers (This can be fixed with adding bots to the games). If you are a fan of FPS like me I would highly suggest you to pick up Storm United and give it a chance.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Storm United is a class-based fast-paced multiplayer FPS. My initial thoughts are very positive for this game as I love this genre. One may find it quite similar to Quake Live in its gun play and action.

In its current state, I will give it:  6/10

Pros: A collection of 15 different weapons. All unlocked at the very beginning. Happy Fraggin !!
A variety of maps, 6 in total.
A Suggestion/ Bug reporting interface (Unified Development Hub) built into the main menu itself. Here you can vote for your top 3 choice of features, add polls and to-do lists. Basically, it gives a simple way to voice your opinion straight to the devs.
Runs on Windows, Mac OSX and Linux. Its nice to see the dev thinking about gamers on other platforms as well, this early in the game development.
Cons: Only two playable classes - the Guardian and the Shadow. As the name suggests, the Guardian is an assault class while the Shadow is stealth class.
Only one vehicle available - a buggy. It would have been nice to have more of them. Who doesn't like to explore the virtual terrain on a super bike.
The game directly forces you to choose a clan or create your own as soon as you get to the main menu. This is quite puzzling, since you have no idea what it does when you first start the game. I was worried, that i would be stuck in the same clan/ region and not be able to change. Fortunately you can change that later. A small introduction or tutorial would have been nice instead.
Low player base. I hardly found 5 players to play the game on some German server. This, even after all the promotional key giveaways is slightly discouraging. But this might change in the future and the devs are constantly updating the game.
Lack of servers. Last I played, there are no servers in the Oceania region. Servers are available for North and South America and Europe.
In its current state it is a bit buggy but stable.

My verdict for this game would be to buy it  ONLY  if you want to be involved in the game's development. Else wait for a period of 4 to 8 months after which it will go F2P.
By buying the Steam Early Access, you will get to play the game before everyone else and will get: 1x premium character, 1x exclusive weapon and 1x epic random loot.

Overall, It looks quite promising and has the potential to rise among the likes of Quake and Unreal Tournament.

You can follow the game's development at its  website [www.stormunited.com].

reviewText:
Early Access Review

POSITIVE THINGS:

I have played the game for like only 6 hours but here are the reasons why I recommend this game:

- variety of guns including snipers, assault rifles, machine guns, hand guns, railgun kinda thing, assault rifle with electrical bullet kinda thing instead, disc shooting gun, healing gun, automatic shotguns, grenade launcher, electrical rocket launcher kinda thing.

- cool animation of reload + cool sound effects

- to small extent you can customize your weapon

- different classes (with each class allowing you to use class-specific weapons) allowing diversity and team play

- runs smoothly

- developers are really interactive and are willing to listen your opinions. The game seems to be growing due to their hard effort.

FUTURE POTENTIALS:

So I have made several suggestions about the game and here are the things that are going to come up in the game in the future according to how the devs responded to my suggestion.

- further character customization including armor customization

- further weapon customization (may be being able to attach melee weapon to your gun idk)

- being able to CREATE your own skin for your gun and character

I assume these are not the only things that is going to come up in the future but for now the devs response show that these stuff will come up in the future.

- I also saw in one of the reviews that vehicles will come up as well

CAUTION:

Currently the game is still not complete so you can't expect it to have things that other shooters have. For example, currently you can't access your inventory box in the main menu.

Also, I assume the population is relatively small because I always have a difficult time finding players to play with. To minimize this issue the devs have established a time in which you can meet the most number of players.

MY COMMENT:

- I personally think the price is worth it although you can't currently play it at its full potential. I mean, this game is not near complete and yet you can enjoy it by playing with 20+ guns, each with its uniqueness.

- If you are willing to wait patiently while the devs are working on this game, then you should buy it. By the way, you can get like a premium weapon for free if you buy it early access (check out the store page for more info).

- Make sure you invite your friends! We need more people!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game was given to BlowSomeSteam for review by the developer/publisher. Any thoughts or comments expressed are entirely my own.

I played this game a couple of days ago and I need to say that I was really impressed with it. It is definitely fun and it will worth your time. Each time I played Storm United, I was a little bit happier afterwards and even if it may still be in Alpha 1 version, it looks really promising already.

To start with, Storm United is a class-based multiplayer First Person Shooter. The avail­able classes so far are 4; The Guardian, The Shadow, The Angel, and The Hacker.

You can try out these classes in a variety of maps and in 6 different game modes which are the Freeze Tag, Demolition, Extermination, Capture The Flag, Deathmatch, and the Team DeathMatch.

I found the graphics astonishing considering its current version. The textures, the terrains, the armor that we were wearing were are really well made and with attention to detail.

Moreover, I enjoyed the sound and the sound effects of this game. It was a good call having them open on my 5.1 sys­tem. They were realistic, not annoying at all and they made your stay in the game enjoyable, allowing you to play for many rounds till you realized many hours had passed since you first started playing.

Finally, the gameplay can be characterized as pure awesomeness. It felt really smooth and solid and it had good mechanics and control of your character and the elements around you.

Here's a quick list of pros and cons:

POSITIVESGreat graphics
Running smoothly
Really good gunplay
Fun to play
Amazing sound and sound effects
A variety of guns, maps, and you have different classes to select from
NEGATIVESFew people can be found online playing it
Some servers were quite laggy
Lack of achievements
If you are a fan of FPS like me I would highly suggest you to pick up Storm United and start playing it right now. It is an awesome game with huge potential and you should definitely give it a try.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

In brief:

Pros:
-Pretty graphics
-Lots of weapons
-Four different character classes add gameplay variety
-Offers traditional modes like Deathmatch and Capture The Flag, while having new modes like Freeze Tag and Extermination
-Fast-paced, and pretty dang fun if there's enough players
-Works pretty good with Steam controller right out of the box
-Fantastic Linux support (~40 FPS on ultra graphics settings with a GTX 750 Ti)

Cons:
-Not enough players. Half of the time all of the servers are dead
-Online only. No bots to keep you entertained when you're offline or while you're waiting for someone to join
-Lack of interaction from the developers every once in a while; updates are few and far between
-Left and Right Thumbstick clicks on gamepads do not register in the Key Bindings menu. That means you can't sprint with Left Stick Click
-GUI isn't optimized for gamepads
-You'll notice about 50% of the time, your bullets will go straight through your target without them taking any damage. Could be lag, could be something else, I dunno
-Assault (Guardian) class only has grenades available for item equipment. Other classes have more options to choose from
-No weapon descriptions. Not even ammo count, etc.
-Some maps don't work on Linux (GPU overload)
-No VOIP support
-Randomly get kicked from a server occasionally. Sometimes you can't join a server at all
-Rocket/grenade launchers are frustratingly overpowered, despite some folks saying it isn't. Did I mention headshots count with these too?
-In-game acheivements are a bit wacky. Revenge" for defeating a player who didn't hit you first? "Headshots" for walking over a mine? "Super Mario" for dying because of jumping off a ledge too high?

EDIT: Regarding "Super Mario" getting achieved in the improper way
date:
the community manager of the game didn't believe me. So here's video proof: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BykxPpX0yWLdOGk0am9uOTQzMTA/view?usp=sharing

-F2P when early access phase is complete. Why pay for a game when you'll be exposed to problems like I've described above when you can wait for them to get fixed and not have to fork over a dime?

But overall I would recommend this game - it's fun

(@ bodybeef, here is my review that I promised you)

(The following is my honest review.)

I usually don't purchase early access games but this was recommended to me by a friend and was on sale so I decided to pick it up. I definitely was not disappointed as it turned out be a fps with a lot of promise. Storm United described by many as being a fast pace shooter although not quite as fast pace as quake or UT but fast pace nonetheless. Using iron sights is optional, though I find myself not using most of the time which I suspect is the case with most players.

There are four classes, Guardian, Shadow, Angel, and Hacker. These classes cover the usual roles you see in class based games, (assault, support, medic...) Great visuals and textures, a style that reminds me of Halo. Game play is smooth and easy to get into for first time players. The game modes are traditional with a few unique ones. The maps are well designed as well.

As far as the cons go the main one that many pointed out is the lack of players. Its difficult to find a decent amount of players. Until the community picks up I suggest the devs organize more events as that is the best time to find the most players. There is also occasional server problems that make it difficult to join games and server lag. These are issues that should get fixed as the game develops so it's not a big issue for me. Vehicles are not in the game yet. so I can't comment on them yet. I would also like to see Bots introduced into the game. I think that would increase the community and be a big improvement.

Overall I am impressed with the game at this stage.
